title: Danjo Islands
text: The are a small uninhabited <a href="List%20of%20islands%20of%20Japan">Japanese island group</a> in the <a href="East%20China%20Sea">East China Sea</a> situated approximately south-southwest of the <a href="Got%C5%8D%20Islands">Gotō Islands</a> and administratively part of the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Japan">city</a> of <a href="Got%C5%8D%2C%20Nagasaki">Gotō</a>, <a href="Nagasaki%20Prefecture">Nagasaki Prefecture</a>. The five main islands of , , , and together stretch some from north to south and cover an area of . The islands, their flora, and their fauna are protected as a <a href="Monuments%20of%20Japan">Natural Monument</a>, <a href="Protected%20Forests%20%28Japan%29">Biotic Community Protection Forest</a>, <a href="Wildlife%20Protection%20Areas%20in%20Japan">Special Wildlife Protection Area</a>, and <a href="Important%20Bird%20Area">Important Bird Area</a>. Birds found on the islands include the <a href="Japanese%20murrelet">Japanese murrelet</a>, <a href="streaked%20shearwater">streaked shearwater</a>, <a href="brown%20booby">brown booby</a>, <a href="Ryukyu%20robin">Ryukyu robin</a>, <a href="Japanese%20wood%20pigeon">Japanese wood pigeon</a>, and <a href="Pleske%27s%20grasshopper%20warbler">Pleske's grasshopper warbler</a>.
